inlineContent.text: The general formatting is done by applying Swift‚Äôs official formatter, known as swift‚Äêformat. More information about it is available at ‚Äπhttps://github.com/apple/swift-format‚Ä∫.

Inside a Workspace configuration, the configuration for swift‚Äêformat is found under ‚Äúproofreading.swiftFormatConfiguration‚Äù and it uses the Swift API from its own SwiftFormatConfiguration module. See ‚Äπhttps://github.com/apple/swift-format/blob/508.0.0/Sources/SwiftFormatConfiguration/Configuration.swift#L20‚Ä∫
Setting the entire property to nil will completely disable swift‚Äêformat.
: A language to use instead of the one specified in preferences.
: The location of the target project if it is not at the current working directory.
: Attempts to download and temporarily use the specified version insead of the one which is installed.

: A list of IETF language tags or SDGCornerstone language icons. Semicolons indicate fallback order. Commas indicate that multiple languages should be used. Examples: ‚Äúen-US‚Äù or ‚Äúüá∫üá∏EN‚Äù ‚Üí American English, ‚Äúnv,en;es‚Äù ‚Üí both Navajo and English, otherwise Spanish

: A file system path. The form ‚Äú/‚Ä¶‚Äù indicates an absolute path. The form ‚Äú~/‚Ä¶‚Äù indicates a path relative to the home directory. Anything else is interpreted relative to the current working directory.

abstract.text: Normalizes the project‚Äôs files by removing trailing whitespace, applying Unix newlines, performing canonical decomposition and formatting Swift files.
Workspace automates management of Swift projects.
